title: Farmers hold meeting in Muzaffarnagar, resolve to mobilise against BJP ahead of polls in UP
content:
Thousands of farmers from across the country on Sunday gathered in Uttar Pradeshâ€™s Muzaffarnagar district in a show of strength against the Centreâ€™s three contentious agricultural laws. They are participating in a Kisan Mahapanchayat, or farmer congregation, called by the Samyukt Kisan Morcha.At the gathering in the government inter-college grounds, Bharatiya Kisan Union spokesperson Rakesh Tikait said the farmers would discuss strategies to continue their protests against the legislations.â€œWe take a pledge that we will not leave the protest site [at Delhi borders] even if our graveyard is made there,â€ Tikait said, according to ANI. â€œWe will lay down our lives if needed, but will not leave the protest site until we emerge victorious.â€Protests against the three legislations started in November last year.
